His business has grown gradually through loans.  His main clients are children and young people, those that come every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  His principal game suppliers are the shopping centers that specialize in technology.  

Currently, he is applying for a loan through Kiva.  It is his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will buy video games, which will upgrade his services, and a television.  With these, he plans to attract his clients, preparing for the vacation period that occurs at the half-way point during the school year.  His investment will be successful because he will use it to buy the most modern games on the market, which are the games that his young clients like the most.  

His goal is to continue growing as a businessman and to be able to take specialized classes.  His greatest challenge is to have sufficient resources to realize these goals immediately.

loans.use: to buy video games that will upgrade his services, and a television.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 20 years old and single. She sells cups, plates and drinking glasses in Thika town. She also supplies some to hotels and restaurants. She has been in this business for the past two years and it has been profitable.

This is her second loan term from KADET Ltd. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cups, plates and glasses to sell. She will use the generated income to buy more stock for her business.

She hopes to open a shop and sell the cups, plates, glasses and other household utensils at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cups, plates and glasses to sell.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her husband and 2 children. Her husband owns a hardware shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family. 

Shama has requested a loan amount of PKR 45,000 from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. With the help of the loan her husband will purchase welding rods, iron rods, iron sheets and soldering rods to sell. This will help him to grow his business and to increase his net income. 

Shama is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase welding rods, iron rods, iron sheets and soldering rods to sell.

loans.name: Bicotty

texts.en:
Bicotty is 42 years old, married, and blessed with four children that she supports. She has been running a retail shop in Bomet for the last four years, getting a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

With a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products, e.g. sugar, tea leaves, crates of bread, and milk to sell.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, tea leaves, crates of bread, and milk to sell

loans.name: Yunis

texts.es:
Yunis  es una mujer de 48 años de edad, que habita al sur de la ciudad con su hijo de 15 años. Allí tiene su propio negocio de confecciones, experiencia que data de hace 32 años, cuando después de capacitarse en el arte de confeccionar, experimentó en pequeñas fabricas y finalmente en el año 2006 se dedicó a esta tarea. Su experiencia comercial la obtuvo con una droguería, donde logró relacionarse con muchas personas, que más tarde se convertirían en sus clientes. Hoy tiene un taller ubicado en su propia casa, el cual fue producto de sus esfuerzos y adquirió cuando su amiga se enfermó y no pudiendo dedicarse a este oficio, se lo vendió a Yunis. 
En la actualidad vende de contado y a crédito y sus principales clientes son comerciantes de productos de confecciones, vecinas, amigas que conocen muy bien la calidad con la que Yunis trabaja y no la cambian. Su tarea la realiza de lunes a sabidos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche para poder cumplirle a todos y su mayor meta es ampliar su infraestructura para sacar a su hijo adelante y este es su mayor desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  telas, hilos y productos de confecciones. Con su credikiva logrará aumentar su producción y disminuir los costos por concepto de compras en volumen y este es justamente el éxito de eta inversión.
texts.en:
48-year old Yunis lives in the south of the town with her 15-year old son. She has a sewing business there, and has 32 years’ experience with this line of work. After training to be a seamstress, she tried working in small factories, and then finally in 2006 she opened her own business. Yunis obtained business experience from working in a pharmacy where she was in contact with many people who later became her customers.

Nowadays she has a workshop located in her own home which she acquired when her friend became ill. Her friend could no longer run the workshop so sold it to Yunis.

Currently Yunis sells both for cash and on account. Her main customers are businesspeople who sell clothing, neighbours, and friends who know the quality of her work and always use her services. She works from 6 in the morning to 8 at night to complete everyone’s orders.

Her greatest goal is to expand her workshop so that she can help her son get ahead. This is also her greatest challenge. Yunis is now seeking a loan from Kiva, the first time she has approached the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the money she plans to buy fabric, thread and other sewing necessities. She will be able to increase production and lower costs through buying in volume, just what the loans are intended to achieve.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread and other sewing necessities

loans.name: Asiya's Group

texts.en: Asiya is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband owns a welding shop. He works very hard to provide for the family. The stock of his shop is almost depleted. Due to lack of funds, he is having trouble purchasing stock for the shop. Therefore, his wife Asiya, a member of 3-person lending group, has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase welding rods, iron rods, iron sheets and soldering rods for him to sell. This will be very helpful for her husband in continuing his business, and this is the only source of income for his family. Her house is situated in rural area where the sanitation system is not good, with the result that mosquitoes in her area are spreading serious diseases. With the help of his profits, she wants to buy a small house in a new location as soon as possible. She is hopeful that the loan will be really helpful for her family and her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase welding rods, iron rods, iron sheets and soldering rods to be sold in her husband’s shop.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir, 59, is a farmer. He is married and the father of one son. He has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past thirteen years. He chose this business because it is profitable and because there is always high demand for fresh food. People use fresh vegetables every day and include them in many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every family table in Azerbaijan and are often made into fresh punch. Tahir sells his crops in the Sabirabad central bazaar. His monthly income is 400 AZN. His son actively helps him to raise his crops. Tahir also receives a pension. As his products are in high demand, Tahir wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN. He will buy seeds and fertilizers with his loan funds. This will be his fifth loan, and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand.

loans.name: Chanura Marup Group

texts.en:
Leishembi joined Chanura Marup when all the members were still single and weaved together to generate income for themselves and their families. Leishembi is the featured borrower member, and she is pictured with her hand raised. 

She is married now with three children. She runs a tea shop and also weaves traditional attire. 

Leishembi's main business is weaving and her woven products are women's wrap-around skirts and traditional shawls. She was making a good profit but her sales entirely depend on the festive season. She makes good sales during marriages, send-offs and other events and sales goes down once it is off season. So she also started running the tea shop in the front yard of her house. 

The tea shop is near the main lane in the neighbourhood, which adds an advantage for her business. The tea shop is a popular place for all age groups in the neighbourhood. She is jolly and also a very good chef. Elders, women and children love the foods Leishembi prepares. People swarm in the tea shop especially in the morning and at noon time. 

She serves Puri, chow-mein, smash potato fry and toast. Many school-going children depend on her tea shop for breakfast and she works hard to prepare so the children can eat their breakfasts and be on time for class. Besides running the tea shop, she also weaves at night and also gets finished woven products from other weavers and supplies them for profit to the women vendors at the main market. With both the businesses in hand, Leishembi now has a daily income as well as seasonal income, which enables her to make savings.
 
With the Kiva loan, she will purchase sacks of flour and wheat and a full tin of edible oils for her tea shop. With the profits she will order woven products from other weavers and sell them for profits. Her growth in financial stability since the inception in the group has been huge and beneficial says Leishembi. She has managed to open a bank account and also send her children to private schools for better educational quality. She thanks Kiva and WSDS for the impending financial assistance and support towards the group.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving and tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour and wheat, a tin of edible oils and necessary supplies for her tea shop.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is 33 years old, married to Beatrice, and blessed with one child. He has been in this business for the last three years with a monthly income of about KES 22,000.

He has applied for KES 70,000, his seventh loan from KADET LTD, which he will be using to purchase another motorbike. With the anticipated profit, Micah will start other businesses. His hopes and dreams are to make sure his businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a hardworking and kind woman. She is a responsible housewife and the mother of 3 children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a very poor family and sustains her family life by facing many hurdles.  

Her husband is a cobbler by profession and his income is inadequate for their household needs. Shahnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase leather, soles and Rexine (artificial leather) for her husband's shop so that he can increase his income.

Shahnaz hopes that her children can live a better life in the future. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase leather, soles and Rexine (artificial leather) for making shoes.

loans.name: Fatmire

texts.en:
Fatmire, 38, is a married housewife and the mother of three adult children. She lives in a southern part of Kosovo in the Ashkali community, but her husband currently lives and works in construction in Germany, which is the main source of income for his family.

This family is very poor and lives in unacceptable conditions. Their house is small, and during the rainy season and wintertime they have a problem with the windows and doors. 

Fatmire is in need of a loan to buy plastic windows and door frames for her house. The loan will help her to improve their living conditions. She hopes in the future to offer a better life to her children. She is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for improving the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy plastic windows and door frames.

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en: Rufat is 60 years old, married, and has three adult children. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He cultivates their farmland by planting vegetables and fruits, such as cucumbers, tomatoes, quinces and dates, to be sold. He supports his family. He plans to expand his vegetable production to achieve higher production. One of his children, his eldest son, is getting married. For this reason, he is applying for a loan of 1000 AZN. He believes that, with the financial assistance of KIVA lenders through VFAC, he will be able to help his son. Rufat wants to contribute and help his son with his wedding expenses, as he has some financial needs.

loans.use: to help with his son’s wedding expenses.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 50-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, which provides the all the income of his family. Currently the condition of the rickshaw is not good, and it needs maintenance. Because of the condition of the rickshaw, her husband is unable to generate any income, and he is facing serious financial issues. Samina wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible, so that her husband can continue his work. For this reason, she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her husband to continue his business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Su'ad

texts.en: Su'ad is a 34-year-old married woman. She lives in Tulkarem in a small house with her husband. Su'ad's husband is a worker with low wages, which barely cover the family's needs. Su'ad has her own project, which is store selling clothing and home appliances. This project is a profitable one, but it needs more money to improve. Su'ad took a USD 3,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help Su'ad to buy more stock for her store. This loan will increase Su'ad's income. Su'ad had the photo taken in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Nazaket

texts.en:
Nazaket is 52 years old and the mother of two sons. She is a very hardworking lady because  for 15 years she has grown fruits and vegetables in her yard and sold them in the bazaar. In this business her son also helps and from this business her monthly profit is 100 AZN. She also teaches pupils at school.

In Azerbaijan, fruit is in very high demand and people like to eat fresh fruit a lot. Besides her fruit, she also sells flowers. Nazaket is really optimistic about the future, regarding the expansion of her business, in order to raise the standard of living of her family.

For this, she has applied for a loan of 1,900 AZN. Nazaket has already taken a loan from Aqroinvest before. She is considered a good customer and this is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for trees.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz Mari Dice a los finaciadores de Kiva " Gracias por el apoyo total a los empresarios de Colombia. " a ella con su anterior credikiva le fue muy bien pues compró víveres que son los articulos de mayor rotación en su negocio y generó utilidades inmediatas. Ella hoy está aplicando aun creidkiva, con el cual comprará productos de aseo y nuevamente agregará víveres, para aumentar su caital de trabajo y responder efectivamente a la rotación de sus inventarios que cada vez es ams rápida. Esta inversión de credikiva se convierte en exitosa porque la aplica en la compra de productos que se venden rapidamente y que comprandolos en volumen adquiere descuentos que van a su bolsa de utilidades.
texts.en: Luz Mari has a message for Kiva donors: “Thank you for all the support  you give to Colombia’s business people.” All is going well, and with her previous loan from Kiva she bought food items which have the greatest turnover and generate immediate income. Now Luz is applying for another loan to buy cleaning products and more food items to stock her store which constantly needs replenishing. The money helps her run a successful business because she buys products that sell quickly. Through buying in volume she is able to get discounts and generate more income.

loans.use: buy food items in volume and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is widowed and has four children. She sells second-hand cloth in Beahu near Takoradi, which she has been doing for five years. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase increased amounts of second-hand cloth, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of cloth that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand cloth.

loans.name: Sedef

texts.en:
Sedef is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of six beautiful children. Sedef and her husband are engaged in their own business in order to have the income to meet their family's needs. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 13 years. During these years, she gained the necessary skills and knowledge for the effective management of her business. 

She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. She also makes homemade yogurt and sells it, together with fresh milk, to her neighbors. Her monthly income is about 144 AZN. This business is the only source of financial income in her family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, as people use it in everyday dishes like pilau (a rice dish) and dolma (stuffed grape leaves).

Now Sedef would like to buy more animals. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN. She will buy three calves and one milk cow. This will be her fourth loan with AqroInvest, and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milk cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old, married, and supports a family of nine members. He is a mixed farmer and he has been in the business for the last six years. His monthly income is about KES19,000.

He is currently servicing a second loan from KADET LTD of KES 40,000 that will facilitate him in acquiring fertilizers and pesticides. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. His future dream is to improve the living standards of his family

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria está muy contenta con su anterior inversión producto de su credikiva, pues le fue muy bien, ella logró surtir su negocio con papelería calzado informal, gorros, artículos domésticos, que le generaron mayores utilidades. Sus condiciones habitacionales mejoraron y también con sus utilidades compró una nueva vitrina en la que ha organizado toda la mercancía. Ella envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva donde les pide  “que continúen apoyando la causa y el desarrollo de comunidades. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con el cual comprará artículos para mamá, pues se acerca el maravilloso y comercial día de las madres y requiere tener todo lo que la mujer-madre necesita, como cosméticos, ropa, calzado, accesorios femeninos, artículos eléctricos etc Con esta inversión de Kiva sus ventas serán muy exitosas pues oportunamente la hace en una de las temporadas mas comerciales en su municipio. .
texts.en: Candelaria is very happy with her previous investment in products from a Kiva loan. It went very well for her. She was able to stock her business with stationery, informal shoes, hats, and home items that generated her a greater income. Her home conditions improved. She also used her income to buy a new display case where she has organized all her merchandise. She sends a message to the Kiva lenders asking them to "continue supporting this cause and the development of communities". She is now applying for a new loan with which she will buy typical gift items for mothers; the wonderful and commercial Mothers' Day is coming up and she needs to have everything that mothers need, such as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, women's accessories, and electronics. With this investment, her sales will be very successful. It is opportune that she is taking out this loan in one of the most commercial seasons in her municipality.

loans.use: to buy Mothers' Day items such as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, women's accessories, electronics, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Yessenia

texts.es: Sandra es una señora trabajadora y emprendedora, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en la zona donde reside ya que es un negocio que le da como resultado buenas ganancias y que es muy buscado por sus vecino ya que es un producto de primera necesidad para todos diariamente, solicita financiamiento para la compra de maíz y cal para la elaboración de las tortillas y asi poder seguir con su negocio y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She earns her living selling tortillas in the neighbourhood where she lives. The business brings in good money as the tortillas are sought after by her neighbours and are  a daily necessity for everyone.

Sandra is seeking a loan to buy corn and lime to make the tortillas and in this way continue with her business and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn in volume and lime

loans.name: Al-Mashar Group

texts.en:
Al-Mashar is a group of six women living in Taiz, Yemen. They were granted a loan of 180,000 YER by AMB. They aim to improve their businesses by using this loan.

Samah is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has operated a small business of selling clothes, incense and perfumes for many years. She found it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to buy various kinds of clothes, incense and perfumes because most of the profit she makes goes to her family. 

Therefore, she decided to apply for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy clothes, incense and perfumes to expand her business. This loan will improve her ability to attract more customers, which in turn will result in improving her income and helping her to go over the poverty line.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense and perfumes to expand her business.

loans.name: Sahei Group

texts.en:
“Life seems tough and challenging since my husband left for the heavenly abode,” says Lhaineikim. 

She is the featured borrower member of Sahei Group and is pictured with hand raised. Since her husband passed away, she takes care of her three children. She takes both the father's and mother's roles and shows strong character.

She has continued extensive aquaculture, which she and her husband used to do. She uses the pond that was dug by her husband and his friends and then raises fish in the pond, which is located just across the house. 

Managing the family expenses with the retirement monthly pension of her husband was difficult. In order to supplement the family income, she joined the group and availed loan.  

She bought hundreds of fry and twats with her first loan. She also bought feed from the markets called powdered-husk. Since it is an extensive aquaculture, she entirely depends on the natural vegetation of the pond. She usually feeds the powdered husk in smaller quantities at a consistent time. She usually sells the fish to women vendors in the town market when they are full grown. 

She says there was a time when all the fish died from an unknown cause. She was disappointed, but her love for fish farming urged her to continue raising fish. She says it is multipurpose because she loves raising fish and at the same time it generates income. She uses the profit for her children's education and the rest is used for household maintenance. She also managed to join the group's savings and she is happy to be part of the Sahei Group.

She says that neighbours' children and poultry get inside the house perimeter and play in the fish pond. She says it is sometimes rude to chase or chide the children and that eventually creates enmity between neighbours.
 
With the Kiva loan, she will purchase fencing nets for the fish pond. If she can arrange a proper fencing for the fish pond, then she won’t have to worry about the fish in the pond. She says thank you to Kiva and WSDS for the support and says please continue helping us.

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, cattle rearing, ginger farming, vegetable selling and a paan shop. The group members encourage one another and support each other in their businesses and also conduct meeting on the second Sunday of every month.

loans.use: To purchase fencing nets to keep neighbours' poultry away from the fish pond.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 23 years old and runs a bakery business in Tala town. He is single and from the income that he gets from his business, he is able to support his siblings by paying for their education.

This will be his first loan term from KADET Ltd. and he plans to buy more stock of wheat flour for baking. This will enable him to meet the high demand of bread from his customers.

He will use the generated income to pay school fees for his siblings. He hopes to grow his business by supplying bread to all the retailers in Tala town.

loans.use: To buy more stock of wheat flour for baking.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es: Don Aquilino es un hombre trabajador y responsable con sus labores, vive en casa propia con su esposa y una hija son muy conocidos en la zona y posee buenas referencias personales de parte de ellos, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijoles, y maicillo de lo cual ya tiene muchos años de experiencia en el campo debido a que toda su vida a laborado en la tierra, solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: Abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, pesticidas, etc.  para seguir trabajando y sembrando para que sus ventas sean mayores y ganancias de igual manera y poder darle a su familia una mejor estbailidad economica.
texts.en: Don Aquilino is a hard-working man who is responsible in his work. He lives in his own home with his wife and one daughter. They are very well-known in the area and Aquilino has good personal references. He cultivates corn, beans, and sorghum. He has many years' experience in the field because he has worked the land all his life. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides in order to keep working and sowing so that his sales and earnings will increase. This way, he will be able to give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has one child.  Her husband is a driver. She specializes in selling provisions in Beahu near Takoradi, which she has been doing for three years. 

Agnes is requesting a loan, which she will use to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. In the long term,  Agnes plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad  is 32 years old and single. He lives with his family and helps them because his parents are very old. Since they are retired, Elshad's parents are highly dependent on his income. 

In 2010, he started to grow fruits and vegetables in his own yard. Sometimes his father also helps him in this business because it is the only income for his family.

Elshad grows fruits and sells them in the Sabirabad bazaar. His monthly income from this business is 300 AZN. In Azerbaijan fruits are in a very high demand and people like to eat fresh fruits a lot. Besides his fruit sales he also sells flowers.

Elshad is really optimistic about the future, regarding the expansion of his business, in order to raise the living conditions of his family. For this, he has applied for the loan of 1,500 AZN. Elshad has already taken a loan from Aqroinvest before. He is a good customer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nyamkhuu

texts.en:
Nyamkhuu, 29 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a rental apartment. 

She has position in the transportation monitoring department at the train station. Before this job, she had been working as a dressmaker and health analyst since 2003 in various work places. Her husband works as a serviceman at the bus station. Their son is first-year student at high school.

Last year they began building their own house on a plot of land after acquiring the license to own the land from the state. But due to a lack of finance, they didn't finish the work, so she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement, gypsum and planks. As a result, the family can finish building their house and move from the rental apartment into their own home. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children, aged 10 and 2 years respectively. She has been running a retail shop for the last four years, getting a monthly income of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

With a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion. Her future dreams is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 43-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns an electronics shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Rubina, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase electronic goods such as cables, bulbs, wires, switches, holders, etc. 

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase electronic goods such as cables, bulbs, wires, switches, holders, etc.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is single and has one child. After successfully graduating from junior high school,  Anastasia is now an established businesswoman. She sells cosmetics in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family,  Anastasia uses her income to provide for her child. 

Anastasia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics to sell, thus aiding her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with two children. She has received some schooling till the end of primary six. 

Currently, Lydia sells maize in Beahu (near  Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about five years now. Her husband is a driver. Lydia’s income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Lydia will use the loan to increase her existing maize capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Lydia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing maize capacity.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan is grateful to Milango and its partners for the first loan he received. His business witnessed high returns, and he now looks forward to making a little development to his family. 

Alan would like to pay for his children's school fee requirements and carry out farming, now that it is the farming season. He is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to pay school fees and buy seeds/fertilizers for his farm. He believes the income from the business can meet the required repayments.

loans.use: To pay school fees and buy seeds/fertilizers.

loans.name: Muhsinjon

texts.ru: Мухсинджону 30 лет. Он женат на доброй женщине, которая является опытной портнихой. Мухсинджон не имеет  детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 3 года назад он начал свой бизнес услугой перевозки строительных материалов, как песок, цемент и т.д. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Мухсинджон старается развивать бизнес и таким образом получать больше дохода. Мухсинджон имеет доброе сердце. Он хочет помогать своим родственникам, которые нуждаются в материальной поддержке. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США  для покупки транспорта марки ЛАБО. Он будет нанимать шофера, и таким образом будет развевать доход. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhsinjon is 30 years old. He is married to a kind woman who is an experienced seamstress. Muhsinjon has no children. In order to provide for his family, three years ago he launched a business providing transportation services; he transports construction materials, such as sand,  cement, etc. His efficiency helps him to be successful. Muhsinjon attempts to develop his business and increase his revenues. He has a kind heart. He would like to help out relatives needing financial support. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 USD in order to buy a car of the [Daewoo] Labo brand. He will be employing another driver, thus increasing his revenues. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a car for developing his  business

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Doña Bernarda es una mujer de 34 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completada cursado hasta el 2 grado madre soltera de 3 hijos los cuales los dos mayores estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación y el menor tiene 3 años. Con ella vive la mama la cual le ayuda con sus hijos ya que ella temprano por la mañana se va hacia el campo a trabajar la agricultura en lo que es la siembra de hortalizas (papa, brócoli y coliflor). Con ella también vive un hermano el cual fue el que le enseño a cultivar hace unos años siendo el, el único apoyo que ella tiene. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y amigos que conocen de su producto; pero como toda siembra y cultivo no deja de tener riesgo siendo estos las plagas y la variación de precios en el mercado. 

Actualmente solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra de papa comprando semilla certificada ya que es más segura higiénica y limpia, por medio de esto ella podrá aumentar sus cultivos y obtener una mejor ganancia del mismo.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar con las ganancias otra clase de semillas para poder cultivar más hortaliza y poder brindar una variedad a sus clientes para su compra/venta; pero la prioridad de ella es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales teniendo una mejor educación y a sí mismo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Doña Bernarda is a hard-working 34-year-old woman with an incomplete elementary education; she studied until grade 2. She is a single mother of three, and her two eldest are in elementary school; her youngest is three years old. Bernarda's mother lives with her and helps her with the children, since Bernarda goes to the fields early in the morning to farm. She sows vegetables (potato, broccoli and cauliflower). One of her brothers lives with her as well; he was the one who taught her to farm years ago. He is her only support. She sells her produce through intermediaries who travel to the area. She also sells to neighbours and friends who know her products. However, as with all crops, there is always risk: plagues and fluctuating market prices.
She is now requesting a loan to invest in planting potato. She will buy certified potato seeds, as these are more certainly hygienic and clean. She will thus be able to increase her crop and improve her income from it.
Her dream is to be able to improve her home, to use her earnings to buy another type of seeds in order to cultivate more vegetables, and to be able to offer variety to her clients. However, her priority is to see her children become professionals with a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds to plant.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 38 years old and married. She has four children.

She sells mosquito nets in Thika town and she has been in this business for the past five years.

This is her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of mosquito nets to sell. This being a rainy season, the demand for the mosquito nets has been high and this will enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business by supplying mosquito nets in all areas of Thika town, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of mosquito nets to sell.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia, 43 years old, lives in the capital city of Georgia with his wife, four children and father. Ilia requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start a family business, but with no success. His loan requests were consistently rejected due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Nowadays the family is without a source of income. In the Khashuri district the family has a 2.5 hectare plot of land which has not been cultivated for years and provides only a little food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Ilia's request for a loan from Credo to start a family business has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Ilia will purchase a milking cow and a pig as he plans to resettle in the Khasuri district and start a husbandry business. He will cultivate the land and produce dairy products after purchasing a milking cow. This will give him a chance to generate income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow and a pig.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with three children. She has received some schooling till the end of junior high school. Currently, Joyce sells African print cloth near Takoradi. She has been involved in this industry for about three years now. Her husband is a trader. Joyce's income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  

Joyce will use the loan to increase her existing African print cloth inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Joyce plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing African print cloth inventory.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Margret is a 38-year-old single mother with one child and two orphans who stay with her at home. 

In order to look after her family, Margret grows bananas and Irish and sweet potatoes on a small scale for both commercial and home consumption. She is a hard working woman but is challenged by price fluctuations in the market.

Margret borrowed a loan of 700,000 UGX from the institution to pay last term's school fees for her daughter, who is in a nursing school. Now the daughter is about to take her exams for the second semester and she does not have money to pay for her. She has thus applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX to pay for the school fees.

In the photograph is Margret and the loan officer.

loans.use: To pay school fees for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a lot of fertilized eggs and to buy two young cows

loans.name: Adjimon Samuel

texts.fr: Adjimon Samuel est âgé de 29 ans et est marié à Vioutou une revendeuse. Le couple a sept enfants tous scolarisés, dont quatre à leur charge. Adjimon Samuel vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Adjimon Samuel à arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis une quinzaine d'années, Adjimon Samuel vend du porc, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Adjimon Samuel s’approvisionne dans un marché au nord du Bénin et au Burkina-Faso, un pays voisin. C’est la première fois  que Adjimon Samuel demande l’appui financier de ALIDé. Ceci lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son  activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en:
Adjimon Samuel, age 29, is married to a reseller named Vioutou. The couple have seven children who have all received schooling, and four of them are still in their care. Adjimon Samuel lives with his wife and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Adjimon Samuel quit school at the primary level. For the past 15 years or so, he has been selling pigs to support his family. He buys his stock at a market in northern Benin and in Burkina-Faso, a neighboring country. 

This is his first time seeking the financial support of ALIDé. This will help him to bolster his activity, expand his client base, and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy pigs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy three calves and fodder for his animals

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es: Doña María de 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hija, es una señora trabajadora y responsable con sus deberes, actualmente se dedica a la atención de una tienda que es el negocio que ella posee vende de toda clase de productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, maíz, fríjol, canela, aceite, sal, macarrones, etc. que son los productos mas utilizados en los hogares para la alimentación. Doña Maria solicita un prestamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio sobre todo los granos básicos que son los mas buscados tambien de aceite, refrescos, golosinas, etc. para así no perder los clientes por falta de mercadería y que sus ventas sean mas grandes y así mismo tener un mejor nivel económico.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives with her daughter in a house she owns. She is a hardworking woman who is responsible with her duties. María has a store where she sells all kinds of staple food products, such as sugar, corn, beans, cinnamon, oil, salt and macaroni, all commonly used by households.

María is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business, especially grains, which are very sought after. She will also buy oil, beverages, sweets, etc. in order not to lose her customers because they cannot find what they are looking for. She wants to increase her sales and reach a better financial condition.

loans.use: to buy grains, oil, beverages, sweets and other supplies for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vehicle tires for a passenger transport business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is grateful to Milango and its partners for the loans she has received. She was able to restock the business from the previous loan and realise a high/extra income from the business.

She is now applying for a new loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings (KES). She will use this loan to pay her child's school fee requirement and to buy additional retail stock, including kerosine, coconuts and other fruits. Rehema believes the business can meet the required repayments.

loans.use: to pay her child's school fee and to buy additional retail stock, including kerosine, coconuts and other fruits.

loans.name: Lydie

texts.fr: Madame Lydie vit avec son conjoint déclarant en douane et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 08,03 et 02ans et seul l’ainé est scolarisé. En 2011, elle a démarré la vente des couches pour bébés et les livre en quantité considérables à ses clients. Son premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter des marchandises. Elle espère créer d’autres points de vente et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Ms. Lydie lives with her husband, a customs agent, and their three children, in Lomé. They are 8, 3, and 2 years old, and only the oldest one is in school. In 2011, Ms. Lydie started selling baby diapers and delivering them in considerable quantities to her customers. Her first loan will enable her to purchase some merchandise. She hopes to establish other sales outlets and to see her family thrive.

loans.use: to purchase baby diapers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia produces palm oil in Beahu (near Takoradi).  She is a widow, and she has four children.  As the sole breadwinner in the family, Cecilia uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase palm fruit in greater quantity, which she will use to produce the oil. The greater quantity will aid her to improve her overall sales of oil.  As a junior high school level, she understands the importance of education in improving social conditions; thus, she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of palm fruit, for palm oil production

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 28 years old and has 2 children. Yaser lives with his family of 6 members, of whom 2 assist him in earning the family income.

Yaser owns a small shop where he sells electrical goods and supplies. He established his business in 2012 and gained experience through working at his friend's shop for 3 years before establishing his own business. Yaser now has a good reputation in his neighborhood thanks to the good quality and competitive prices of his goods.

Yaser is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to install extra shelves in the shop, to install a rolling shutter and some signage, as well as to increase his inventory of electrical supplies. Yaser is aiming to continue to grow in the market so that he may take better care of his family.

loans.use: to install extra shelves in the shop, to install a rolling shutter and some signage, as well as to increase his inventory of electrical supplies

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, Afi revend depuis 2005 des produits d’alimentation générale et du charbon de bois. Maman de 05 enfants tous à l’école, Afi quant à elle est âgée de 42ans et a pour conjoint un chauffeur. Elle désire assurer l’avenir des enfants au coté de son conjoint tout en rendant pérenne son activité c’est pour cela, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente l’aidera à atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: To help meet family needs, Afi has been selling grocery item and charcoal since 2005. A mom with five children, all in school, she is 42 years old, and her husband is a driver. At her husband's side, she would like to ensure her children's future while making her business sustainable. To do so, she is requesting her first loan to purchase some merchandise. The profit derived from the sales will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Wendteegre Group

texts.fr:
Mme HONORINE DASSAMIAN  est responsable du groupe WENDTEEGRE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 01 va à l’école. Mme a 01 personne en charge.
Mme vend des parfums depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez un grossiste au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont dans les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  05 douzaines de parfum.
Mme veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour son activité et aider son mari pour les charges de la  famille.
texts.en:
Ms. HONORINE DASSAMIAN is the official of the WENDTEEGRE group. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 28 years old, and the youngest is 18. One goes to school. She has one person to support. 

Ms. HONORINE DASSAMIAN has been selling perfumes for five years. She gets her supplies from a wholesaler at the market in her district. Her customers include both men and women. 

She wants to purchase 5 dozen of perfume. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to open a store for her business and to help her husband cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 5 dozen of perfume to sell.

loans.name: Bahiya

texts.en: Bahiya is 48 years old and a widow. She supports five children, by selling clothing items at home. Now Bahiya is applying for a loan to enhance the area where she shows the clothes, by obtaining more clothes hangers and racks to organize things better, and also to buy a new women's wear summer collection, to add to what she has in inventory.

loans.use: to buy more hangers and racks to better organize her sales space, and a new women's wear summer clothing collection to add to her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy flour and wood for bread making

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy toffees and candies to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 48-year-old man who asked his son to appear in the photo instead of him for security reasons. Mohammad is supporting a family of 7 members from the income he makes from his automobile accessories shop. In his shop, Mohammad and his son Azzam sell different types of car accessories such as special seat covers, lights, etc. Mohammad is applying for a loan to buy more car accessories such as steering wheel covers, mirrors, interior mats, etc.

loans.use: to buy more car accessories such as steering wheel covers, mirrors, interior mats, etc.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 43-year-old motorcycle operator in Changamwe, Mombasa. He is a married father of four children. He has been in this business for the last five years and has been doing well.

This marks his third loan from KADET LTD to pay school fees for his children. He has serviced his previous loans successfully.

He hopes to educate his children to be self-dependent so that he can grow his business further.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children in primary and secondary school.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam, who is 28 years old, is a married youth client from Iraq. He has 2 children and works hard to provide for them by himself.

Wissam owns a shop where he purifies and distributes water to farms and houses. He established his business in 2010 and since he is the only person who practices such a business in the area, his experience and reputation grew rapidly in the neighborhood.

Wissam is requesting a youth loan of $2,000 which he will use to install a rolling shutter in his shop. Wissam is aiming to grow his business even more and increase his profits so that he may be able to educate his children and provide them with a successful life.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter in his shop.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan, 48 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2011. He has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them quickly to their destinations and finding shortcuts. His wife works as an interior decorator, at a private business entity. Their elder son is a graduate year student, and their younger son goes to high school.

Batsaikhan is requesting a loan of 900,000 MNT. He will use it to engage in a building materials sales business this summer. Using the loan, he will purchase building materials such as planks, bricks, cement and shingles, from China. He will sell the materials later, at retail prices, to local people and business entities. During this time of year, demand for building materials increases drastically, so he can profit from this demand and will improve his living standard. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to supply building materials to individuals and entities during the warm season, when demand is high

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Agatha is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her kenkey in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been involved in preparing and selling kenkey for 10 years. She is married and her husband works as a security personnel. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Agatha wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty kenkey. In the long term, Agatha plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: purchase a greater quantity of maize.

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en:
Yosam is a married man, age 43, with 4 children who are all going to school. He is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from home, although at times he takes them to Kampala. He says he works 7 days a week. He also has a banana plantation that can fetch him a good income at the end of a month.
 
Yosam started this business in the year 1987 and says he has been able to pay school fees and meet his daily needs through this business. He says the need to take care of his family inspired him to start this business and he has done well from it. His main clients are fellow cattle traders and butchers, although some who would like cows for keeping purposes also seek his services.

His main challenge is cattle disease that leads to quarantine. He describes himself as a hardworking man and encourages lenders to reduce on the interest rate.

loans.use: to buy more cows for trading.

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en: Saddam is a 22-year-old single man who has eight siblings. He is a public university student majoring in nursing. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for his fees for next semester.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine isa 71-year-old widow who is still in the business of dairy farming. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. She plans to use the loan to purchase a bigger piece of land to increase her farming activities.

loans.use: to buy a bigger piece of farm land

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 20 years old and a single guy. He is the older brother of four siblings. 

Omar is a governmental university student majoring in social services and studies. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es: Doña Gioconda habitante del barrio Concepción de María, una zona donde los pobladores son de escasos recursos, ella es una madre trabajadora que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo le ha brindado lo básico a sus hijos como la alimentación, ahora son mayores de edad y le ayudan. Ella se dedica a la venta variada como: tortillas, ropa, cosméticos entre otros para cumplir con los diferentes gastos que nunca faltan, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en calzados, cosméticos y ropa para buscar como vender ya que esta es su unica manera de ganarse la vida, con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Gioconda lives in Concepcion de Maria barrio, a zone where the residents have scarce resources. She is a working mother who with much work and effort has offered the basics to her children, including food. Now they are adults and they aid her. 

Gioconda sells a variety of things, including tortillas, clothing, and cosmetics, among other things, to meet the expenses that are always there. The loan she requests is to be invested in foot ware, cosmetics and clothing that she will attempt to sell, because this is the only way she has of earning a living, with the aid of her husband.

loans.use: to buy foot ware, cosmetics, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por prestarme esa ayuda a mi y a mi negocio” Ella cuando aplicó anteriormente a su credikiva logró comprar una máquina plana industrial, con la cual ha mejorado sus calidad y os tiempos productivos y pasó de hacer ojales manuales, a usar la máquina para hacerlos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, porque se acerca la temporada en la que se celebra el día de la madre, época  que es eminentemente comercial y Elvira necesita estar preparada con productos para sorprender a su  clientela  y para que las madres de sus compradores estén elegantemente vestidas con ropa elaborada en su propio taller.
texts.en: Elvira tells her Kiva lenders "thank you for providing this help to me and my business." When she previously applied for a Kiva loan, she was able to buy an industrial machine, which has improved her quality and production time. She stopped manually making buttonholes and now uses the machine to make them. Currently, she is applying for another Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies because Mother's Day is coming up. This season is largely commercial so Elvira needs to e prepared with products to surprise her customers, and so that mothers of her friends can be dressed elegantly with clothing made in her studio.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and sewing materials

loans.name: Bismaillah

texts.en: Bismaillah is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a tailor by profession. Presently, he is interested in purchasing a new stitching machine, and a variety of thread, buttons and fabrics, for his work. However, due to a lack of capital, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Bismaillah has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband. By doing so, her husband can increase his net income and savings in the future. With the profit amount, she will save money and start her own tailoring business at her home. She is grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a new stitching machine, and a variety of thread, buttons and fabrics, for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Regina  is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling footwear in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years.  Regina  is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a tailor. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children's school fees.  Regina  will use the loan to purchase more footwear inventory, thereby aiding her to increase her overall sales. With the profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear inventory, thereby aiding her to increase her overall sales.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 21 years old. He lives in Khashuri District with wife and father, who is provided with a retirement pension. 

George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Nowadays the family is out of sources of income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, George will open an auto workshop. He has already purchased an oil replacement unit. He will purchase a stock of oil and filters and will get orders to change oil and filters in cars. This will increase the income of his family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open an auto workshop.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa is a 35-year-old married lady and the mother of three kids. Asmaa used her previous loan to buy more children's toys and girls' accessories. She is now applying for another loan to add more home products and make her store a place where both mothers and daughters can find items that interest them.

loans.use: to buy more home products for her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is still working as a dairy farmer. He is requesting a third loan to expand his farming activity and buy more dairy cows to rear for milk production. He is now earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He hopes to buy a bigger plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to expand his farming land and buy more dairy cows.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en: Majd is a 27-year-old, single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hardworking man but only receives a low salary and faces difficulties to improve his living conditions. He says that his salary is not enough to cover his expenses due to the high price of goods in the market. He intends to buy a washing machine for household use so he has applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. He hopes to improve his living standards so that he can get married and buy a taxi to provide for his family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Togtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Togtokh, 41 years old, lives with his family in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. He has been working as a driller at mining company for six years. Before his wife took maternity leave she worked at restaurant. 

The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some repairs such as changing the roof, installing a vacuum, insulated windows, and insulation. So, he is requesting a loan of 2800000 MNT to purchase shingles, a vacuum, insulated windows, and fiberglass. Using these materials he can renovate his house, thus making his home a more comfortable and warmer place. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase shingles, a vacuum, insulated windows, and fiberglass.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 40 years old. He lives in Khashuri District with his wife, two children and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. Otar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays, the family does not have a source of income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Otar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Otar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Otar will open a plastic workshop. He will purchase equipment and raw materials and will get orders to make different kinds of plastic materials. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a plastic workshop for his start-up business.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 25-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. 

She has a home business selling blankets and home detergents that she wants to enhance so it can return more profits for her. For that, she applied for a youth loan to buy lighter bed cover sets and more detergents to sell.

loans.use: to buy lighter bed cover sets and more detergents to sell.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur is 39 years old, married, and the father of three sons. His wife is housekeeper. 

He has a car shop where he is repairing different parts of automobiles. He is a master in this field because he can fix all kinds of problems related to engines and he has 10 years of experience in this field. His monthly profit is 400 AZN.

He needs additional fund to invest in new equipment for his shop. In his city everybody has a car, and of course people need a good master for their car. Now he needs a 1000 AZN loan. This new loan will help him to increase the efficiency of his garage by purchasing new equipment. He will be able to repair cars of larger sizes.

He has a good loan history and this is his fifth loan.

loans.use: to invest in new equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and has one child. 

Hussain specializes in selling women's outfits. He has been practicing this business since 2011 and has gained much experience through working at a similar shop as an employee for several years. Now, Hussain has an employee hired, is becoming well-known in the surrounding area, and has gained an excellent reputation.

Hussain is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to renovate his shop. He believes that this loan will attract more customers and will increase his total profits. With the increase in his profits, Hussain will be able to take better care of his family and provide them with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Carmen Lourdes

texts.es:
La clienta Carmen vive en Quevedo. Cuando se caso decidió tener una actividad para ayudar a su esposo. Una de las oportunidades es quefuera de su domicilio hay una cancha de futbol y decidió vender chuzos (carnes envuelta en palillos). Actualmente hace su trabajo sola en algunas ocasiones con la ayuda de su suegra. 

Por el momento no tiene ninguna dificultad. Esta casada su esposo trabaja de chofer, si tiene hijos los cuales están en escuela fiscal. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar mesa, sillas para su negocio y para mejorar su vivienda comprando cemento. Su sueño es crecer con su negocio y tener un retaurante.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in Quevedo. When she got married, she decided to have a business to help her husband. One of the opportunities is that outside her home there is a soccer field, and she decided to sell "chuzos" (grilled meat on a stick). Currently she works on her own, and sometimes with the help of her sister-in-law.

She has no difficulty at the moment. She is married and her husband works as a driver. She does have children, who are in public school.

With the loan, she wants to buy tables and chairs for her business, and to improve her home by buying cement. Her dream is to see her business grow and to have a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and to fix her home.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 49-year-old mother of three who is married to a government sector employee. Wafaa is helping her husband to improve their family's living conditions by selling clothes at home to friends and neighbors. She is now applying for a loan to increase her stocks, including a new summer clothing collection.

loans.use: to increase her clothing stocks, including a new summer collection of clothes.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, de 48 años de edad esta casado con Marlene , con quien tiene tres hijos , juntos viven en su casa propia.Desde hace 26 años, él se dedica a la agricultura razón por la cual siembra arveja, papa y maiz además de diferentes flores de gladiolos, en los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres ;lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar las papas y flores de gladiolos que vende rápidamente en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, por la calidad que reconocen sus clientes; esta actividad le permite vivir cómodamente y a la vez brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos, también con las ganancias que obtiene puede adquirir animales como vacas, caballos y asnos que facilitan sus labores agrarias, sus deseos de progresar han hecho que para  el futuro piense en comprar terrenos productivos y sembrar en mayor cantidad.Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene Kiva , razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual y responsable con sus cuotas .Orlando, invertirá los S/. 3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Orlando is 48 years old and married to Maria, with whom he has 3 children. They live together in their own house. For 26 years he has been dedicated to agriculture, sowing green peas, potatoes, and corn, in addition to different types of gladiolas in the fields he inherited from his parents. 

What Orlando likes most about the work is harvesting potatoes and gladiolas, which sell rapidly in the wholesale market of his city due to their quality, which is recognized by his customers.

This activity allows Orlando to live comfortably and, at the same time, to provide an adequate education for his children. Also, with the earnings, he is able to obtain animals such as cows, horses and asses to facilitate the agricultural work. His desire to progress has led him to consider buying productive lands for sowing larger additional fields in the future.

This is Orlando's 4th loan through Kiva, making him even more committed to being punctual and responsible concerning his payments. Orlando will invest the 3,000 sols in purchasing organic manure to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his fields.

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en: Mrs. Baasankhuu, 41 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a janitor at a private business entity. Her husband has a position as a welder at a private business entity. Her elder two daughters go to high school while the youngest one is in kindergarten. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs major repairs. She is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, she and her husband can repair and insulate their house thereby providing more comfortable and warmer accommodation for their daughters. Also, a renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and emit less smoke, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for her home.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Afin de  satisfaire les besoins des clients, madame Eya sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des sacs de mais et de charbons de bois. Elle mène cette activité depuis 2007 et s’y plait bien car elle lui procure des revenus qui lui permet de s’occuper de sa famille. Elle espère à l’avenir devenir grossiste et fonder une famille financièrement stable. Notons qu’elle est maman d’01 enfant de 08ans qui est scolarisé. Elle est âgée de 32ans.
texts.en: In order to meet customer demand, Mrs. Eva is seeking a second loan from WAGES to buy bags of corn and charcoal. She has been in this business since 2007 and likes it since it allows her to provide for her family. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler and ensure the financial stability of her family. We should mention that she has one eight-year old child who is in school. She is 32 years old.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and corn.

loans.name: Joffre Javier

texts.es:
El cliente Jofre vive en Quevedo.  Empezó ayudándole a vender a una señora legumbres y frutas. Poco a poco ahorro dinero y decidió comenzar a comprar y a vender por si solo las legumbres y verduras. En la actualidad continua con ese trabajo de venta de verduras y vegetales.

Por el momento no tiene ninguna dificultad, no es casado, tiene 1 hijo pero no estudia todavía.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar legumbres, frutas para tener mas viveres de premera necesidad para sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jofre lives in Quevedo. He began by helping a woman sell vegetables and fruit. Little by little he saved money and decided to start buying and selling fruits and vegetables on his own. Currently he is continuing with this business selling fruits and vegetables.

He has no difficulty at the moment. He is not married, and has one child who does not go to school yet.

With the loan he wants to buy vegetables and fruits so that he can have more basic groceries for his customers. His dream is to have a large business and to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 33 years old and married with one child. He has a money transfer service business in the town of Tala that he has been in operation for the past three years. He also sells credit cards as well as phone accessories. His business has been profitable.

This will be his second loan term and he plans to use the loan to buy mobile phone accessories such as batteries, phone covers, phone chargers and earphones for sale. He will use the generated income to buy more phone accessories.

He hopes to expand his business by opening a bigger phone sales shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Jesukpego 17 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO 17 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Fatimata Ida est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Fatimata Ida est âgée de 39 ans. Fatimata Ida n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Fatimata Ida est mariée à un certain Bruno. Le couple a un enfant  qui n’est pas scolarisé et est à leur charge. Fatimata Ida vit avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Fatimata Ida vend des tissus de façon ambulante depuis dix huit ans. Fatimata Ida s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Fatimata Ida sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 17, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group JESUKPEGO 17 is composed of three persons who are friends living in the same village. The group's representative, Fatimata Ida, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 39 years old. She did not attend school. She is married to a man named Bruno. The couple have in their care one child, who is not in school. Fatimata Ida lives with her husband and child. 

The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. To do so, Fatimata Ida has been selling cloth door to door for eighteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Fatimata Ida is requesting, along with the other members of the group JESUKPEGO 17, a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Fanny Yessenia

texts.es:
La clienta Fanny vive en Quevedo. Comenzo desde hace mucho tiempo a vender tortillas, una de sus motivaciones para comenzar fue uno de sus hijos ya que le dio la idea de ponerse este negocio para tener un ingreso fijo. En la actulidad  sus hijos le ayudan a vender las tortillas. 

No tiene ninguna dificultad, no es casada, si tiene hijos los cuales están en escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  cocina, mesa y cobertor. Su sueño es tener su propio local y dar felicidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in Quevedo. She began selling tortillas a long time ago. One of her motivations for starting was one of her children, who gave her the idea of setting up this business so that she could have a steady income. Currently her children help her sell the tortillas. 

He has no difficulty, is not married, and does have children who attend public school. 

With the loan she wants to buy a stove, tables and a cover for her stall. Her dream is to have her own shop and to give happiness to her children.

loans.use: To buy a stove, tables and something.

loans.name: Tèko

texts.fr: Téko est célibataire. Âgé de 28ans il revend des habits dans une boutique et s’approvisionne chez les grossistes venus de la CHINE. Il sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des habits afin de  satisfaire les besoins des clients. Il voudrait agrandir son activité et fonder une famille financièrement stable. Il a démarré en 2006.
texts.en: Téko is unmarried. He is 28 years old and sells clothing in a store. He is supplied from wholesalers from China. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES to purchase some clothing to satisfy customers needs. He would like to expand his business and start a financially stable family. He started in 2006.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Jules Sètondji

texts.fr: Jules Sètondji est âgé de 40 ans et est marié à Noëllie une revendeuse. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, quatre sont à la charge du couple. Jules Sètondji et sa femme vivent dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Jules Sètondji a peu fréquenté l’école, et appris la couture. Dans son atelier, Jules Sètondji vend également des produits de mercerie. Jules Sètondji exerce ce métier depuis une vingtaine d'année, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Afin de répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Jules Sètondji désire acheter une machine à surfiler. Jules Sètondji s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria.
