Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she'll buy bags, dresses, footwear, and hair products to use as supplies as well as to sell.

Her goal is to continue supporting her children.  Her biggest challenge was managing to support her family, which is also her biggest success.

loans.use: to buy bags, dresses, footwear, and hair products

loans.name: Estrella Del Norte Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cinco socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Angela mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de dos años, su negocio es la venta ropa nueva, zapatos de damas, cosméticos de la Zermat y prendas romanel, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a esa actividad anteriormente era ama de casa, de estar con la institución tiene cuatro años que a demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de adulto como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas de hombre, blusas de dama, prendas como cadenas, pulseras, anillos, pulseras de pies, zapatos de damas, etc. el crédito anterior le permitió comprar más productos variados como las prendas y los cosméticos. Ana tiene 35 años su negocio es la venta de ropa de mujer, zapatos de damas, Angela tiene 47 años su negocio es venta de ropa y zapatos, Lili tiene 33 años su negocio también es la venta de ropa y zapatos y Judith tiene 21 años su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five enterprising members, one of whom is Angela, a 26-year-old woman who is married with a two-year-old child. She sells new clothing, women's shoes, Zermat cosmetics, and Romanel products. She has had this business for seven years. Before that, she was a housewife. She has been with the institution for four years, and has demonstrated responsibility in her repayments. She will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing for adults, such as men's and women's pants and shirts; as well as jewelry such as chains, bracelets, rings, and anklets; women's shoes; and other items.
Her previous loan allowed her to buy more and varied products such as garments and cosmetics.
Ana is 35 and sells women's clothing and shoes. Angela is 47 and sells clothing and shoes. Lili is 33 and also sells clothing and shoes. Judith is 21 and has a general store in her home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's and women's shirts; gold jewelry like chains, bracelets, rings, and anklets; women's shoes; etc.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos. El vive con su familia, su esposa y cuatro hijos los cuales están estudiando; el oficio lo heredo de su padre y este lo lleva a cabo desde las 5:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el rendimiento de sus cosechas. El riesgo que existe en esta actividad son los  cambios drásticos que afectan la producción o una posible plaga en el cultivo.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando mucho para obtener una buena cosecha para mejorar los ingresos económicos y asimismo darle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José plants basic staples and raises hogs. He lives with his family - a wife and four children, who are in school. He inherited his work from his father, and works from 5:00 am to 4:00 pm.
He needs this loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides. This investment will help him to improve his yield. The risks in this line of work include drastic changes that affect production, and plagues.
His dream is to keep working a lot in order to obtain a good harvest and improve his income, thus providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and other items.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. He used his previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. His investment was profitable, and he was able to pay back the entire loan amount on time.

David has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fertilizer and more seeds for planting. He anticipates making more profit, which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to expand his farming business by planting more cash crops, thereby making more income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: Hakim is a 21-year-old married lady. The man shown in the photo is Hakim’s husband, who is a wholesaler by profession. He purchases different goods from the market and then sells them to various shops, transporting them by motorcycle. He has been doing this for many years in order to meet the family's expenses. In order to increase their sales, Hakim has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. The loan would enable her husband to purchase more items such as packs of biscuits, grains, and sweets. Hakim is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one and will bring positive changes to her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as packs of biscuits, grains, and sweets.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for 5 years. She stitches balls of different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs, and she earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. 
 
Gulzar is a motivated mother of four children. She is responsible for providing them with good quality food, education, and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 25,000 PKR. The loan will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, and spools of thread in large quantities, which will allow her to cater more customers without delay. She hopes to expand her business, which ultimately will help to generate more cash. She would like to spend part of her anticipated profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of materials for making footballs

loans.name: Keyvin Omar

texts.es:
Keyvin, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: frijol y maíz, vive con su mama y sus hermanas, no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el oficio lo realiza desde hace ochos años y este lo aprendió con sus padres, lo lleva a cabo de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; la inversión le ayudara a tener una siembra segura y obtener ingresos.
Su sueño es ayudar a su familia con los gastos y aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Keyvin cultivates basic staples such as beans and corn. He lives with his mother and sisters and has no family abroad. He has been a farmer for eight years and learned this work from his parents. He works from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm.
This loan will allow him to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and other items. This investment will help him to have a secure crop and to obtain income.
His dream is to help his family with their costs and to increase production.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and other items.

loans.name: Japhesa

texts.en:
Japhesa is a 43-year-old secondhand clothing dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married man whose spouse provides additional income, and together they support three people.

This loan will be his second to finance his business. Japhesa will use the loan to purchase bales of secondhand jackets and raincoat, which will be in demand for the coming season. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his shop. He hopes to succeed in this business and become a wholesale trader of secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand jackets and raincoats

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old. He lives in a small village in the Tskaltubo District with his wife, two children, grandson, and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. David requested loans from local financial institutions several times in order to start a family business, without any success. His loan requests were always rejected on the basis of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

David's family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a plot of land, where they grow different kinds of vegetables. David’s son works as an artisan and gets a small monthly income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

David has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and restart-up credit with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to other credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers.” With his loan, David will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, he plans to sow vegetables. The harvested vegetables will be sold at local markets, which he hopes will increase the family's income. David anticipates that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde es una microempresaria de muchos éxitos y emprendedora en su negocio, es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, con cuatro hijos varones de 6, 20, 24 y 27 años de edad, desde hace 15 años destaza cerdos en pie lo cual vende fritos con tortillas, nacatamales, chicharrón y comida al medio día. Cuenta con seis trabajadores que le ayudan al negocio así como dos de sus hijos le ayudan a despachar y vender sus productos. Tuvo problemas de salud en el transcurso del crédito pero fue superado, en el crédito pasado logro comprar un freezer para almacenar la carne del cerdo etc. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo en pie, granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, vegetales, leñas, etc.
texts.en:
Matilde is a very successful and enterprising businessperson. She is 45 and married with four sons ages 6, 20, 24, and 27. She has been raising hogs for 15 years and sells pork products such as fried pork with tortillas, nactamales, and chicharrón [fried pork rind] at lunchtime.
She has six workers who help her with the business, and two of her sons help her to prepare and sell her products. She had health problems over the course of her previous loan, but she has overcome it. With her previous loan she was able to buy a freezer to store the meat and other items. She will invest this loan in the purchase of live hogs and basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, firewood, etc.

loans.use: to purchase live hogs and basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, beef, chicken, vegetables, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca es una microempresaria de éxito mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera, desde hace 1 año se dedica a comercializar mercadería en general como ropa, perfumen de dama, perfumen de varón, chips, celulares, accesorios, ella misma comercializa sus productos,y labora como asistente en una farmacia de la capital, este crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, perfumen de varón, perfumen de dama, chips de celulares, celulares, accesorios de celulares como carcasas, cargadores, etc.
texts.en: Blanca is a successful micro-entrepreneur. She is 42 years old, single and for a year she has worked selling general merchandise including clothes, perfumes, colognes, cell phones, phone chips and accessories. She sells the products herself and she also works as an assistant in a drug store in the capital. She will invest this loan in purchase of men's and women's pants, cologne, perfume, cell phone chips, cell phones, and cell phone accessories like cases, chargers, etc.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothes like men's and women's pants, cosmetics like cologne and perfume, and cell phones and cell phone chips and accessories.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a vigorous 46-year-old mother of four. For many years, she has been stitching clothes for the people of her community, and she uses her income to support her entire family. Due to insufficient funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, Zubaida has requested a loan of PHR 15,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packages of laces, zippers, and buttons. She hopes the loan will help her to increase her revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income. This will be her first loan, and she is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To buy thread, laces, zippers, and buttons for making clothing.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 31-year-old man from Naivasha. He is married to Susan, and they have two children who are in school. For the past five years, Benson has been in the business of supplying polythene bags. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more stock of polythene bags for resale. He paid back his previous loan successfully.

Benson hopes to expand his business and be among the top polythene bag suppliers in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags to sell

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is married with 5 children. She was educated through primary school. Currently, Millicent sells provisions in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this business for about 2 years. Her husband is in construction. Millicent's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. She will use the loan to increase her inventory of provisions. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Millicent plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: increase her inventory of provisions

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. El vive con su compañera de vida  y su niña de tres años de edad; el oficio lo realiza desde hace 20 años y este lo aprendió de sus padres, lo lleva a cabo de 6:00 am a 3.00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros; este le ayudara a fortalecer la productividad.
Su sueño es ayudarle a su familia con los gastos cotidianos del hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar cultivates corn and beans. He lives with his partner and three-year-old daughter. He has been a farmer for 20 years and learned this work from his parents. He works from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.
He needs this loan for the purchase of manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and other items. This will help him to strengthen his productivity.
His dream is to help his family with the daily household costs.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and other items.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama, 26, is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

Salama has operated a grocery business for the past eight months, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Salama dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale grocery shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, mangoes, and cabbages. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, mangoes, and cabbages.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma tiene 43 años de edad y vive acompañada de su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia.Su actividad económica se centra en la agricultura, desde muy temprano se dirige junto a su esposo a los terrenos agrícolas que poseen en la zona alta de su anexo, donde todos los días se dirige para cuidar de sus cultivos de maíz, plátano, yuca y cacao. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y con los ahorros que tenía a comprado más terrenos de cultivo. En sus inicios tuvo muchas dificultades ya que contaban con el terreno pero no tenían las siembras para su cultivo, es así que gracias a la experiencia que tienen en este rubro pudieron salir adelante, y conseguir una buena producción. Con la ganancia de la cosecha de sus cultivos y el ingreso extra que obtiene en la parroquia , Wilma espera comprar una parcela para la siembra netamente del cacao.Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva, agradece de antemano el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con sus pagos .El dinero solicitado de S/.2000 soles lo invertirá en la compra de un terreno para aumentar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Wilma is 43 and lives with her husband and two children in her own home. She works in agriculture; very early in the morning, she and her husband go to their lands in the high zone of their neighbourhood. There, every day, they care for their crops of corn, banana, yucca, and cocoa. She has worked in agriculture all her life and has used her savings to buy more land.
In the beginning she had many difficulties because she had the land but not the crops; but thanks to her experience she has been able to get ahead and obtain good yields.
With her income from her harvests and the extra income that she gets in the parish, Wilma hopes to buy a plot of land where she will sow only cocoa.
This is her first loan on Kiva. She says thank you in advance for this support and promises to be punctual with her payments. She will invest the requested 2000 soles in the purchase of land to increase her crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: Elba Concepcion

texts.es:
Elba, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar huevos, azúcar, sodas, golosinas, aceite, entre otros productos para tener variedad de mercadería para los clientes.
El préstamo anterior fue de mucha ayuda para el negocio y logro obtener ganancias; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Elba is once again seeking a loan to buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, candy, oil etc. for her business. These items will provide her customers with a variety of merchandise.

Elba’s previous loan helped her a great deal and she earned more money. Her financial situation and her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, candy, oil etc

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has a clothes business and a bakery business, both of which are located in Naivasha. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to buy stock for his bakery, such as flour, sugar, charcoal, and other supplies. He paid his previous loan on time. With anticipated profit, he hopes to buy a heifer.

Wilson hopes to own the biggest bakery in Naivasha in the near future.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and charcoal for his bakery

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
This is Suleiman. He used a previous loan to buy additional foodstuff for his retail shop. His earnings were a big help in the education of his children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another loan, this one for 35,000 Kenyan shillings, to buy additional stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. The more items displayed in the store the better. 

Having more items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from his business will definitely help him to provide for his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Elsa Andrea

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa  tiene 24 años, es soltera,   la Sra. Elsa se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elsa va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Elsa va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Elsa es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 24 years old and single. She makes a living selling cosmetics from a catalog. She visits homes and public and private offices in the city of Santa Cruz to offer her products. 

This loan is her second with the institution. Elsa will use this loan to buy discounted wholesale cosmetics and jewelry. She will then be able to offer a variety of products to her clientele, increasing her earnings. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving her business. Elsa will use the profits to continue buying a variety of beauty products. 

Elsa is a very hardworking person, and she is happy for the opportunity she has been offered as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 64, is married and the mother of two. She lives in Msambweni. 

Rose sells green groceries with help from her family. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. 

Rose always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money to create a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Kenyan shillings to buy beans, potatoes, oil, vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy beans, potatoes, oil, vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque  necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar pollo, sodas, jugos, aceite, entre otros productos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar el inventario de mercadería, aumento en los ingresos y estos los utiliza para financiar el estudio de sus hijos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado gracias al préstamo otorgado por Kiva.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan because she needs more working capital in order to continue investing in her business. This will allow her to buy chicken, soda, juice, oil, and other products.
Her previous loan helped her to increase her inventory of merchandise. Her income increased and she used it to finance her children's studies. Her economic conditions and her family's circumstances have improved thanks to her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soda, juice, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Juan Leonidas

texts.es:
Juan, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar materia prima tales como: hilo, agujas y realizar un nuevo molde para la elaboración de hamacas.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo  a obtener una fuente de ingresos extras, ya que por ser discapacitado no puede emplearse; las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que logro adquirir el espacio de tierra donde vive actualmente.
texts.en: Juan seeks a new loan that he needs to continue investing in his business. This loan will allow him to buy raw materials like thread and needles and materials to make a new mold for the production of hammocks. The previous loan helped him to obtain a source of increased earnings, now that he is disabled and cannot obtain traditional employment. His economic conditions have improved now that he was able to acquire the piece of land where he currently lives.

loans.use: to buy thread and needles and to create a new mold for the production of hammocks.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús es un humilde campesino, es originario del municipio de  Yali en las afueras de Estelí, casado, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 son mujeres y 4 son varones, solo el menor está estudiando actualmente. Se dedica a la siembra de cafe organico gracias a la ayuda del financimiento logro sacar su produccion de cafe apesar de la plaga que afecto a las siembra el logro cubris los costos de produccion y cancelar su credito a tiempo. Hoy esta solicitando el financiamiento esta solicitando el credito para la compra de abonos solubles, fertilizantes foliares, insecticidas y fungicidas para el cuido y manejo de su plantación de café.
Con este crédito podrá incrementar su producción porque podrá darle buen mantenimiento a su cultivo.
Sus planes futuros son mejorar su vivienda y compra de materiales y equipos agrícolas. Su meta próxima es  levantar la producción en rendimientos para este nuevo ciclo.
texts.en:
Jesús is a simple man from the countryside who was born in the municipality of Yali on the outskirts of Estelí. He is married and has seven children, three girls and four boys. Only the youngest is still at school. Jesús earns his living growing organic coffee. Thanks to help from a previous loan he has managed to produce coffee despite disease that affected the plants, and he succeeded in covering the cost of production and paying off the loan on time.

Now he is seeking another loan to buy soluble manure, plant fertilizer, insecticide, and fungicide so he can look after his coffee plantation. With the loan he will be able to increase production as the plants will be well cared for. 

In the future Jesús would like to improve his house and buy agricultural supplies and equipment. His next challenge is to boost production and yield for this new cycle.

loans.use: buy soluble manure, plant fertilizer, insecticide, and fungicide for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Abdusamin

texts.ru: Абдусамин в нашей организации кредитуется первый  раз. Он   добросовестный, честный,  целеустремлённый, и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился  в сельской местности, который имеет хорошие условия для животноводства  и  выращивание сельхоз  культуры. Он имеет  достаточный опыт  по  скотоводству и земледелию.  Он  покупает  скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и перепродает на местном рынке по более высокой цене. Он является   единственный кормильцем в семье, так как его жена не имеет отдельный источник дохода и его 4 детей еще не совершеннолетние.   Жена   помогает Абдусамину по введению бизнеса. Вместе с ними и еще живет отец Абдусамина. Отец  Абдусамина, получает пенсию  150 сомони  в  месяц.  Абдусамин планирует развевать бизнес и таким образом получать больше дохода для содержания большой семьи. Он запрашивает займ для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This is the first time Abdusamin takes a loan with our organization. He is a conscientious, honest, purposeful and hardworking man. He was born in a rural area with good conditions for livestock breeding and growing agricultural crops. He has sufficient experience in livestock breeding and agriculture. He purchases livestock, fattens them for some months and resells them at the local market at a higher price. 

Abdusamin is the only wage-earner in the family, as his wife does not have her own source of income and his four children are still not adults. His wife helps him in managing the business. Abdusamin's father also lives together with them. Abdusamin's father receives a pension of 150 somoni per month. 

Abdusamin plans to develop his business and this way receive a higher income for supporting his large family. He requests a loan for the purchase of livestock. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to develop his business

loans.name: Bertha Del Socorro

texts.es: Bertha es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de celulares, reparación y venta de accesorios, esta actividad tiene nueve años de estar realizando, es una mujer casada, con un hijo de seis años de edad, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 4 años es responsable en sus pagos. Su esposo y ella atienden el negocio, anteriormente trabajo en grupo solidario y por su comportamiento de pago se promueve a la metodología individual, con el crédito anterior logro comprar una computadora para la educación de su hijo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de equipos, así como accesorios de celulares como carcasas, chips, cargadores de diferentes marcas, y compra de recargas electrónicas.
texts.en: Bertha is a businessperson who repairs and sells cell phones and accessories. She has had this business for nine years. Bertha is married with one six-year-old child. She has been a client of the institution for four years and is responsible in her payments. She and her husband attend to the business. She was previously part of a communal bank, and because of her good repayment she was promoted to individual loans. With her previous loan she was able to buy a computer for her child's education. She will invest this loan in the purchase of equipment such as cell phone accessories like cases, chips, different brands of chargers, and electronic refills.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of different brands of cell phone equipment such as cases, chips, chargers, and electronic refills.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Don Manuel vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él es una hombre muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. El trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés y pan dulce, sale a comercializarlo antes del desayuno, que es cuando las personas más lo consumen al igual que en la cena. El esta solictando un credito para mejorar el techo de su vivienda comprando laminas y pago de mano de obra ya que con las ganancias que obtiene no logra solventar esos gastos y asi puedan vivir mas seguros en su hogar.
texts.en:
Don Manuel lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He is a very responsible man who is always searching for better economic stability. He works in his own bakery where he makes French bread and sweetbread. He goes out to sell bread before breakfast, which is when people most consume it, as well as at supper time. 
He is requesting a loan to improve his home's roof. He will buy laminate and pay the labourers. His income is not enough to cover these costs, and this way his family will be more secure in their home.

loans.use: to buy laminate and pay labourers to repair his home's roof.

loans.name: Amada Maria

texts.es:
La clienta Amada vive en Guayaquil. Comenzo en su casa vendiendo bolos poco a poco fue mejorando sus ventas hasta que comenzo a invertir dinero en viveres ya que su meta era tener una tienda, poco a poco fue obteniendo una tienda. En la actulidad tiene una tienda donde vende bebidas, granos, enlatados, etc. 

Su dificultad en el trabajo es en ocasiones que se enferma ya que tiene 60 años. Es casada su esposo vende frutas, no tiene hijos menores de edad y los mayores tienen negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere invertir en su negocio comprando enlatados, confites, granos, dulces etc. Su sueño es aumentar la tienda y tener una más grande.
texts.en:
Amada lives in Guayquil.  She started out selling ‘bolos’ [frozen fruit treats] at her house.  Her sales were improving little by little until she started to invest money in foodstuffs.  Her goal was to have a store.  Little by little she was getting a store.  She now has a store where she sells drinks, grains, and canned goods, etc.

The difficulty in her work is that at times she gets sick as she is now 60 years old.

She is married, and her husband sells fruit.  She does not have any minor children; her grown children have a business.

She wants to use the loan to invest in her business by purchasing canned goods, sweets, grains, and candy, etc.  Her dream is to expand her store and to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sweets, grains, and candy, etc.

loans.name: Rajabmoh

texts.ru: Рачабмох молодая замужняя женщина. Ей 21 год. У нее сыночек в возрасте одного годика. Рачабмох со своей семьей проживает в районе Вахш. Вместе с ними также живут отец и сестра мужа. В течение 6 лет Рачабмох и ее муж занимаются торговым бизнесом. Муж продает женские одежды и обуви. Сама Рачабмох продает ткани. В данный момент Рачабмох берет кредит для оборота бизнеса мужа для закупа сезонной одежды и обуви на продажу.
texts.en:
Rajabmoh is a young, married woman. She is 21 years old. She has a small son, aged one year. Rajabmoh lives in the Vakhsh region with his son. Her husband's father and sister also live together with them. 

Rajabmoh and her husband have been working with sales for a period of 6 years. Her husband sells women's clothing and shoes. Rajabmoh sells fabric. Currently Rajabmoh takes a loan to increase her husband's turnover, through purchasing seasonal clothing and shoes for selling.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing and shoes for developing her husband's business

loans.name: Alcides Aristides

texts.es:
Alcides, solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de  venta de sal; este le permitirá comprar bolsas de empaque de sal y  un viaje de sal yodada.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar la producción, aumentaron las ventas e incrementaron los ingresos; las condiciones económicas  y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Alcides is requesting a new loan to keep investing in his salt sales business. This will allow him to buy packing bags. He will also buy one load of iodized salt.
His previous loan helped him to increase production. His sales and income increased; his economic conditions and his family's circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy packing bags and a load of iodized salt.

loans.name: Evelyn Yazaira

texts.es:
Evelyn, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar aceite, azúcar, arroz, papel higiénico, entre otros productos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar los ingresos y estos los invirtió en los gastos básicos del hogar;  las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares, se mantiene el mismo grupo y se encuentran muy bien de salud.
texts.en: Evelyn is requesting a new loan because she needs to invest in her business. This loan will allow her to buy oil, rice, toilet paper, and other products. Her previous loan helped her to increase her income, and she invested her profit in her household's basic costs. Her economic conditions and her family's circumstances have improved. She is in the same group and she is in very good health.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, rice, toilet paper, and other products.

loans.name: Icela

texts.es:
Icela es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y su pequeña hija, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Icela pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Cosmetología, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Icela trabaja como ayudante en un salón de belleza de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de lavado de cabello, pedicura, manicura y otros, Icela trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño.
Icela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá alquilar un pequeño local para poner un pequeño salón de belleza, de esta manera Icela trabajara de manera independiente y espera contar con mayores ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda cumplir su gran sueño de ver a su pequeña convertida en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Icela is 22 years old and lives in the town of Ica with her parents and young daughter. She loves her family and they are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into helping her family get ahead. Thanks to her own hard work and support from her parents she was able to study to be a make up specialist. In her free time Icela likes to cook, and now and again she makes a delicious lomo saltado (beef dish) to share with her family.

After much hard work and through her own initiative, Icela works as an assistant in a beauty salon in the town. She washes hair, does manicures and pedicures etc. She works every day for approximately ten hours a day and enjoys her work. She believes all is going well because of her performance at work.

Icela is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to rent a small property where she can open a beauty salon. She will be independent and hopes to earn more money which will help her a great deal so that in the not-too-distant future she can realize her dream of seeing her little daughter become a professional.

loans.use: rent a small property

loans.name: Manfoat

texts.ru: Манфоату 66 лет. Она добрая и умная женщина. Манфоат вдова и имеет одного сына, которому 38 лет. Она имеет 2 не совершеннолетних внуков. Манфоат более 20 лет занимается выращиванием зерновых культур и имеет большой опыт. Манфоату помогает невестка по ведению бизнеса. Они работают с раннего утра до позднего вечера на поле. Сын Манфоата не имеет постоянное место работы и поэтому он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Он не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета и поэтому попросил мать помочь ему. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1050 долларов США для покупки авиабилета для сына. Этот займ поможет ее сыну найти место работы и зарабатывать деньги для содержания 2 детей, жену и мать. Она ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Manfoat is 66 years old. She is a good and smart woman. Manfoat is a widow and she has one son, who is 38 years old. She has two grandchildren who are not adults. Manfoat has worked with growing agricultural  crops for more than 20 years, and she has a large experience. Manfoat helps her daughter-in-law with managing her business. They work from early morning to late night on the field. 

Manfoat's son does not have permanent work and therefore he would like to go to the Russian Federation. He does not have money for the purchase of flight tickets, and therefore asked his mother to help him. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,050 US dollar for the purchase of plane tickets for her son. This loan will help her son find work and earn money for supporting his two children, his wife and his mother. 

Manfoat awaits your kindness and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase plane tickets for her son, who wants to go to Russia for work.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Es una señora que habita en la ciudad de Estelí hace  nueve años tiene una pulpería con la que ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos varones es madre soltera.  Sus hijos la apoyan cuando no están trabajando pero la mayor parte del tiempo le toca a ella salir hacer compras y atender con mucho cariño a su clientela  recuerda como inicio su primer negocio lo puso en una esquina de su casa y todavía conserva las paredes de la vieja ventanita de la venta ella cuenta que este negocio le ha ayudado a construir su casa es una señora proactiva, poco a poco ha alcanzado sus metas ella necesita este crédito para comprar un frízer que necesita para el negocio para la venta de pollo y gaseosas  doña Haydee considera que comprando ese activo  sus ventas aumentarán y también sus ingresos.  Ella desea surtir más su pulpería con variedad de productos que le solicitan  sus clientes, que cumplan parte de las necesidades básicas pues su meta es logran convertirlo en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Haydee is a woman who has lived in the city of Estelí for nine years. She has a general store which has allowed her to get her two sons ahead. She is a single mother. Her sons help her when they are not working, but the majority of the time she has to go make purchases and tend to her customers alone. She remembers how she started her first business; she opened it in a corner of her home, and she still has the walls of the small display case. She says that this business has helped her to build her home.
She is a proactive woman who has achieved her goals bit by bit. She needs this loan to buy a freezer that she needs for her business selling chicken and pop. Haydee thinks that this purchase will cause her sales and income to increase. She wants to stock her store even more with basic products that her clients request. Her goal is for her store to become a big corner store.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 28, lives in the small village of Akhaltsikhe District with her son and mother, who has a retirement pension. Ana has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start family businesses but without success. Her loan requests have been rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family’s only source of income is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. They also have a plot of land, where maize, haricots and potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products locally and hardly make enough for food for the family. According to Credo, the family belongs in the “subsistence poor” category. 

Within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, Ana has been approved for a loan to start a family business. This start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit. The rural poor are regarded as high-risk borrowers because of their low incomes. 

With this loan, Ana will purchase a car. Her son will help her drive to different villages to trade with dairy products and vegetables. With a car, they will increase their income, as they will be able to transport more products. 

This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car and transport dairy products and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Gladys Milagro

texts.es:
Gladys,  posee una venta de antojitos y tortillas. Ella vive con sus nietos los cuales son los que le ayudan con el negocio; ya tiene varios años de  realizar dicha actividad y también a veces sus hijos le ayudan a llevar a cabo.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar maíz, gas propano, pan dulce, pan francés, pollo, entre otros productos; este le ayudara a adquirir materia prima para invertirlo en el negocio y no existe riesgo porque la mercadería se vende durante el día.
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio y trabajar en el futuro con capital propio.
texts.en:
Gladys sells antojitos [traditional Mexican corn-based dishes] and tortillas. She lives with her grandchildren, who help her with her business. She has had this business for several years, and sometimes her children also help her with it.
This loan will allow her to buy corn, propane, sweetbread, French bread, chicken, and other products. This will help her to have the basic materials to invest in her business. There is no risk because she sells her products during the day. Her dream is to expand her business and to work with her own capital in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane, sweetbread, French bread, chicken, and other items.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: Carmelo es un microempresario de éxito su negocio es la venta de ropa de pacas de sabana, electrodoméstico en menor escalas, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Es soltero tiene 58 años de edad, y tiene dos años de ser cliente de la institución ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de sabanas, electrodomésticos como abanicos, planchas, licuadoras, hornos pequeños etc.
texts.en: Carmelo is a successful businessman. He sells clothing, sheets, and small home electronics. He has had this business for three years. He is 58 and single, and has been a client of the institution for two years. He has proven himself to be punctual in his repayments. He will invest this loan in the purchase of packs of sheets, and home electronics like fans, irons, blenders, and small ovens.

loans.use: to purchase packs of sheets, and home electronics like fans, irons, blenders, small ovens, etc.

loans.name: Mirna Yishel

texts.es:
Mirna, posee una panadería. Vive con su familia, su abuela, su esposo y sus dos hijos los cuales tienen edades de 4 y 5 años; el oficio lo aprendió de su familia y lo realiza de manera independiente sin horarios con la ventaja que cuenta con  una experiencia de 6 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar materia prima tales como: nuevas bandejas,azucar, harina, canela, pan francés, entre otros productos para tener variedad para la venta; este le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio, obtener utilidades y con ello aportar para su familia.
Su objetivo es ampliar el negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Mirna owns a bakery. She lives with her family, her grandmother, her husband and her two children who are 4 and 5 years old. She learned this profession from her family and she started her own bakery independently without a set schedule because she has the advantage of having 6 years of experience. She requires this loan to buy raw materials like new trays, sugar, flour, cinnamon and french bread, among other products so she will have a variety of items to sell. This will help her to fortify her business, to obtain profits and with them to support her family. Her goal is to grow the business and to give a better quality of life to her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy new trays, sugar, flour, cinnamon and french bread, among other items.

loans.name: Edgardo Armando

texts.es:
Edgardo, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. El está soltero y tiene 25 años de edad, vive con sus padres y tiene dos hermanos los cuales no viven juntos; el oficio lo aprendió con su padre y lo realiza de lunes a sábado. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar una vaca y concentrado para engordarla; este le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos  cuando desee venderla.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Edgardo makes a living in agriculture and livestock. He is 25 years old and single. He lives with his parents, and he also has two brothers who do not live with them. He learned about this profession from his father, and he works from Monday to Saturday.

He has applied for a loan which will allow him to buy a cow and feed to fatten it. This will help him to increase his earnings when he would like to sell it. His dream is to strengthen his business and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow and feed to fatten it.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Don Alejandro, 58 años de edad  vive en la ciudad de Estelí, casado padre de familia ,ya sus hijos son adultos , es dueño de un pequeño taller de soldadura con mucho sacrificio puso su taller el cual le ayudó a cumplir su sueños de construir su casita también le ha enseñado a trabajar a sus hijos él no quiere que sus le trabajen a alguien sí no que ellos sean dueños de sus propios negocios.
Don Alejandro sólo finalizo su primaria pero eso no le ha impedido salir adelante  él quiere sacar este crédito para poder comprar hierro, alambre y  otros productos para elaborar portones y ventanas. El considera que este crédito le ayudara mucho porque es una oportunidad que no la quiere perder  pues beneficia a su negocio al tener materia prima para elaborar sus  pedidos. 
Sus metas próximas son elaborar los portones para tener que ofrecer y sus planes futuros son tener maquinarias actuales con las que pueda brindar un servicio más rápido y eficaz. Su mayoría de clientes son en la ciudad de Estelí le gustaría en un futuro llegar a otros departamentos.
texts.en:
Don Alejandro, age 58, lives in the city of Estelí. He is married with adult children. He owns a small welding workshop, which he opened with great sacrifice. It has helped him to achieve his goals of building a home, and has allowed him to teach his children to work. He does not want his children to work for anyone, but rather to own their own businesses.
Alejandro only has an elementary school education, but this has not stopped him from getting ahead. He wants to take out this loan for the purchase of iron, wire, and other products for making gates and windows. He thinks that this loan will help him greatly because it is an opportunity that he does not want to lose. It will help his business because he will have basic supplies for filling his orders.
His next goal is to make the gates so that he will have them to sell. His plan for the future is to have machines so that he can offer a faster and more efficient service. The majority of  his clients are from Estelí; in the future he would like to reach other areas.

loans.use: to buy iron, wire, and other products for making gates and windows.

loans.name: Karen Lizethe

texts.es: Karen es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de ropa de adulto y la venta de cosméticos Avon, tiene 36 años, tres hijos de3,12,4 y 10 meses de edad, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a ese negocio, su esposo le ayuda atender el negocio, de estar con la institución tiene dos años. El crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, brasieres, blúmeres, camisetas etc.
texts.en: Karen is a businessperson who sells clothing for adults and Avon cosmetics. She is 36 and has four children ages 3, 4, 12, and ten months. She has had this business for four years. Her husband helps her to attend to it. She has been with the institution for two years. She will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's shirts, bras, bloomers, shirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's shirts, bras, bloomers, etc.

loans.name: Ergashaly

texts.ru: Эргашали в нашей организации кредитуется  третий раз. Он добросовестный, честный,  целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в сельской  местности.  Он   работает в  заводе  по производству цемента, сварщиком.  Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Его жена и мать заняты выращиванием  сельхоз  культуры и  животноводством.  У него очень большая семья, то есть родители, сестра, жена, ребенок и он сам. Эргашали ели-ели справляется с расходами семьи. Скоро его сестра планирует выйти замуж. Для проведения ее свадебного торжества, семья не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 950 долларов США для проведения свадебного торжества. Этот займ поможет Эргашали сделать счастливой его сестры. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This is the third loan Ergashaly takes from our organization. He is a conscientious, honest, purposeful and hardworking man. He was born in a rural area. He works as a welder at a factory that produces cement. He is married and raising a child. His wife and mother works with growing agricultural crops and with livestock breeding. 

He has a very large family, i.e. parents, a sister, a wife, children and himself. Ergashaly tries to cope with the cost of the family step by step. Soon his sister plans to get married. The family does not have money to hold her wedding celebration. 

Ergashaly requests a loan in the amount of 950 US dollars, for holding the wedding celebration. This loan will help Ergashaly make his sister happy. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To hold a wedding party for his lovely sister

loans.name: Isokjon

texts.ru: Исокжону 47 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а сыновья учатся в школе. Исокжон со своей семьей проживает в городе Вахдат. Он в течение двух лет занимался торговым бизнесом. Однако в 2011 году он прекратил свою деятельность и уехал на заработки в заграницу. Теперь Исокжон хотел бы заново начать свой бизнес. Он уже арендовал торговую точку на рынке. Чтобы закупить товар ему необходимы денежные средства. Исокжон просит кредит для закупа подростковой одежды на продажу.
texts.en:
Isokjon is 47 years old. He is married and the father of three children. His wife is a housewife, and his sons go to school. 

Isokjon lives in the city of Vahdat with his friends. He worked with sales for a period two years. However, in 2011 he closed his business and went abroad as a migrant worker. Currently Isokjon would like to start his business again. He has already rented a selling point at the market. In order to purchase goods he needs financial means. 

Isokjon requests a loan for the purchase of youth clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase youth clothing to sell

loans.name: Elsy Estela

texts.es:
Elsy, posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad. Ella vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos los cuales tienen edades de 8 y 11 años; el negocio lo tiene en su casa y su esposo trabaja como albañil.
El prestamo que solicita le permitira comprar frijol, arroz, huevos, pasta dental, sopas maruchan, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros articulos para surtir el negocio; este le ayudara a mejorar las ventas y aumentar las ganancias.
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio para obtener mayores utilidades y asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elsy has a store where she sells basic staples. She lives in her own home with her husband and children, ages 8 and 11. She runs her business out of her home and her husband is a bricklayer. This loan will allow her to buy beans, rice, eggs, toothpaste, Marucha-brand soup, candy, drinks, and other items to stock her business. This will allow her to improve her sales and increase her earnings. Her goal is to expand her business in order to obtain better profits and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, eggs, toothpaste, Marucha-brand soup, candy, drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Marina Concepción

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina es profesora de educación primaria de unos de los colegio de san Rafael tiene veinte y siete años de laborar para este ministerio.
Es casada su esposo trabaja para emprosa que es una empresa que se dedica al cuido de pozos y bombeo de agua de enacal, tiene ocho años de laborar, tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos menores de edad a su cargo.
El dinero lo solicita para mejora de vivienda la compra de materiales para terminar de ponerle el piso a su casa. Es  una persona trabajadora que con esfuerzos propios y el apoyo de su familia ha salido adelante con la educación de su hijos y darle una sombra donde esté bien como es su casa, gracias a kiva y ceprodel que también han puesto su granito de arena han podido hacer realidad unos de sus mejores sueño el tener su casa toda de piedra, grande y  bonita.
texts.en:
Marina is a primary school teacher at a school in San Rafael. She has been working for the ministry for 27 years. She is married and her husband has been working for a company which maintains wells and water pumps for eight years. She has four children who are under her care.

She has applied for a loan to improve her home by buying construction materials to finish putting a floor down in her house. She is a hardworking person who, with her own efforts and her family's support, has provided an education for her children as well as a roof over their heads. Thanks to the contributions of Kiva and Ceprodel, she is able to make one of her greatest dreams come true, which is to have her house made of stone, large and beautiful.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, and tile).

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Libertador Group

texts.es:
Duo Cristo Libertador
Doña Elba Araceli es originaria de Tecpan, Guatemala tiene 35 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta su hijo de 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de pollos, y tambien a la venta de medicina natural.
Desde hace algunos años ella ha empezado con esta actividad ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante con su familia.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio y ofrecer mas variedad de tejidos a su clientela para obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos y compra de medicina natural para la venta.
texts.en:
Cristo Libertador Duo

Elba Araceli is from Tecpan, Guatemala. She is 35 years old and has a three-year-old son who is under her care. She makes traditional textiles by hand, as well as raising chickens and selling natural medicine. She started this business several years ago, because this is the means she has to provide for her family.

Her husband works as a day laborer. Thanks to his support, she continues to move forward with her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and offer a greater variety of fabrics to her clientele, in order to obtain a higher income and send her children to school. She has applied for this loan to buy materials to make textiles and to buy natural medicine to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional textiles and natural medicine for resale.

loans.name: Shoymardon

texts.ru: Шоймардону 36 лет. Он женат и у него трое детей. Его дети учатся в школе. Шоймардон со своей семьей проживает в районе Яван Хатлонской области. Шоймардон два года занимался продажей авиабилетов в России, приехав на Родину, он продолжает свою работу. Кроме этого он еще помогает жене продвигать деятельность.  Его жена занимается животноводством. Она закупает, откармливает и перепродает крупнорогатый скот. Шоймардон берет кредит для расширения бизнеса жены.
texts.en:
Shoymardon is 36 years old. He is married and has three children. His children go to school. Shoymardon and his family live in Yavan, in the Kathlon area. 

Shoymardon has worked with selling flight tickets in Russia. After going back to his home country, he continued this business. In addition, he also helps his wife develop her business. His wife works with livestock breeding. She purchases, fattens and resells cattle. 

Shoymardon takes a loan to expand his wife's business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for reselling

loans.name: Sofia Herlinda

texts.es:
Sofia es una mujer de 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, Sofia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver novelas y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Sofia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de postres y dulces, ella prepara riquísimas tortas, pasteles, alfajores, mazamorras y otros dulces, los cuales atraen a buenos clientes, Sofia trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Sofia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales e insumos para preparar sus postres, como sacos de harina, azúcar, pasas, quequeras, rodillos y otros, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y tener su casa totalmente terminada.  Antibiótico
texts.en:
Sofia is a 56-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ico with her child. She loves her child very much, and this is her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts her all into getting her family ahead; she has always been both father and mother to her child. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the need to start working at a very young age to support her parents, Sofia was not able to study and become a professional. In her free time, she likes to watch telenovelas. Sometimes she prepares a delicious stir fry to share with her family.
On her own initiative, with great hard work and dedication, Sofia works in her small business selling desserts and sweets. She prepares delicious tarts, cakes, alfajores [a type of cookie sandwich made with dulce de leche], mazamorras [A Peruvian jello-like dessert made of purple corn boiled with pieces of pineapple and other fruits] and other sweets. She draws in a good clientele. Sofia works every day and is able to work approximately ten hours a day. She feels good doing her job and believes that it is going well for her because of the good flavour of her dishes and her kind treatment of others.
Sofia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy ingredients and supplies for making her desserts. She will buy items such as bags of flour, sugar, raisins, cake cases, and rolling pins. This way she will be able to keep working hard to achieve her great dream of expanding her business and completely finishing her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for making desserts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, juice, soft drinks, and pastries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a stationary shop.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José ,61 años de edad, es originario de la comarca La Pava Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí, casado de oficio agricultor.  A él siempre le ha gustado el ganado lechero, por eso año con año cuando obtiene buenos ingresos de la venta de maíz, frijol y café compra una vaca parida para aumentar su ganadero e incrementar la producción de leche para elaborar cuajada y comercializarla de esta manera diversifica sus ingresos. Todo empezó a la edad de 26 años cuando heredo 2 manzanas de tierra de su padre, luego  las cultivo de frijol ese año obtuvo buena producción y con los ingresos compro su primera vaca parida. Posteriormente año después se fue reproduciendo hasta el día de hoy cuenta con 8 vacas paridas. En su actividad agropecuaria lo apoyan sus hijos y esposa. Su producto lo comercializa en su localidad. Su producto le gustaría comercializarlo en los supermercados porque lo vendería a  un mejor precio. Las expectativas que tiene de su negocio son ampliar el número de vacas paridas para incrementar la producción de leche, incrementar la producción de café y granos básicos.  El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, fungicidas para evitar las plagas, mano de obra para darle mantenimiento de tres manzanas de café. El desea comprar maquinarias y equipos para facilitar las labores agrícolas y luchar cada día por una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 61, is from the region of La Pava Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. He is married and works as a farmer. 

He has always liked dairy cattle, so every year when he has good earnings from selling corn, beans, and coffee, he buys a calved cow to increase his number of livestock and his milk production. He makes and sells cheese curd to diversify his income. Everything started when he was 26 years old, when he inherited two plots of land from his father. He later cultivated beans on the land, and that year he obtained good production. With his earnings, he bought his first calved cow. In the following years, he repeated the process, and today he has eight calved cows.

His children and wife support him with his agriculture and livestock activities. He sells his products in his town, and he would like to sell them in supermarkets because they would sell at a better price. His goals in terms of his business are to increase his number of calved cows to increase milk production, as well as to increase his production of coffee and basic grains. He has applied for this loan to buy fertilizer, manure, and fungicides to avoid infestation, and to pay for labor costs to maintain the three plots of coffee. He wishes to buy machinery and equipment to facilitate the farm labor, fighting every day for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and fungicides to avoid infestation, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan, she is requesting of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Lalèyè

texts.fr: Lalèyè est âgé de 41 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Joséphine. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Lalèyè vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Lalèyè a très peu fréquenté l'école, et a appris la couture. En plus de le couture, Lalèyè produit l'huile de palme à base des noix de palme qu'il transforme dans sa région. Lalèyè s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Lalèyè sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Lalèyè is 41 and married to Joséphine, a merchant. The couple has four children under their care, three of whom are their own children. Some of the children are in school. Lalèyè lives with his wife and children. He and his wife take care of the family together. He barely went to school. He learned sewing. He also produces palm oil from palm nuts. He gets his supplies in a town in Bénin. With the goal of satisfying his customers' demand, Lalèyè is requesting his fourth loan from ALIDé. His previous loans were all properly paid back.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and palm nuts.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
For the past years, Zuhura has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Zuhura dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour and renovate her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans, and renovate her stall.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is farmer from Ndunyu Njeru and has applied for her fifth loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her pay school fees and also buy seedlings. She paid her previous loan on time.

She hopes to expand her farming business and improve her family's living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: To pay school fees and also buy seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the costs of her studies.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah has a retail business in Nakuru that she has been running for the past six years. She has applied for her third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy stock for her business.

She paid her previous loan on time. With the anticipated profit, she hopes to open another shop. She hopes to buy a tuk tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business like sugar and flour, among other things.

loans.name: Ayeshatu

texts.en: After graduating primary school, Ayeshatu decided to set up her own ‘Wakye' selling business (Wakye is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She prepares her Wakye on her own and proceeds to sell it in Afosua (near Cape Coast). With over 9 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty Wakye. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a carpenter) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 3 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye’

loans.name: Katty Elizabeth

texts.es:
La clienta Katty vive en libertad.  Empezó a vender ropa con su mamá y poco  apoco  empezó a tener sus propios clientes fue entonces cuando compro ropa con su propio crédito.

En la actulidad su trabajo lo realiza sola de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana. La dificultad en su trabajo son los ladrones que hay en el sector  y los clientes qeu no pagan ya que en ocasiones ella deja la ropa a credito y le da plazo a sus clientes fijos a pagar en cuotas. Es madre soltera tiene un hijo menor de edad.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pantalones, blusas y ropa para niños. Su sueño es tener su propio local comercial en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Katty lives in Libertad. She began selling clothing with her mother, and little by little began to have her own customers. It was then that she bought clothing with her own loan.

Currently she works on her own from Monday to Friday and on weekends. The challenges in her work are the thieves in that part of the city, and customers who don't pay, as sometimes she sells clothing on credit and and allows her regular customers to pay through installments. 

She is a single mother and has a minor child. With the loan she wants to buy pants, blouses and children's clothing. Her dream is to have her own shop in the center of the city.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: After graduating from primary school, Abiba decided to set up her own cassava business in Afosua (near Cape Coast). With more than three years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will help her purchase more cassava for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a purchasing clerk) with the upkeep of their house and to ensure that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava for resale

loans.name: Petita Locadia

texts.es:
La clienta Petita vive en Guayaquil. Por el desempleo y  también porque le gusta la costura comenzó desde hace años atrás a confeccionar ropa de mujer y hombre. Trabaja sola desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00.

Su dificultad es la falta de maquinas de coser para realizar mejor esta actividad. Esta divorciada, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian en escuela fiscal y otros mayores de edad.

Con el préstamo va a comprar tela, hilos, aguja y una maquina de coser para así mejorar su negocio. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande y tener mejores  ingresos.
texts.en:
Petita lives in Guayaquil. Due to unemployment and also because she likes sewing, she started making men's and women's clothing years ago. She works on her own from 8am to 7pm. Her challenge is the lack of sewing machines to better carry on this business. 

She is divorced and has three minor children who go to public school, and others who are adults. 

With the loan, she is going to buy fabric, thread, needles and a sewing machine in order to improve her business. Her dream is to have a larger workshop and to have better income.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Angela Concepcion

texts.es:
La clienta Angela vive en Guayaquil. Ella escogió esta labor de vender cosméticos por catalogo por la necesidad y por el desempleo. Trabaja sola desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00.

Su dificultad es la falta de capital por eso aplico para el crédito. Si es casada el esposo es maestro albañil, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están en escuela fiscal.

Con el  préstamo quiere comprar perfumes cremas y desodorantes. Su sueño es tener un local comercial mas amplio para obtener mejores ventas y mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Angela lives in Guayaquil. She chose this work of selling cosmetics by catalog, through necessity and unemployment. She works on her own from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.

Her difficulty is the lack of capital, and that is why she has applied for a loan. She is married and her husband is a master builder. She has two children who are in public school.

With the loan, she wants to buy perfumes, creams and deodorants. Her dream is to have a larger shop so that she can get better sales and greater income.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and deodorants.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Helped by her family, Rehema sells food. Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to buy vegetables and grains for preparing food. Before, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments in time.

She always struggles to improve her cafe, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Rehema is requesting a loan to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken and food packaging.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken and food packaging.

loans.name: Aastasia

texts.en: Aastasia sells food products in Afosua (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education and is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Aastasia has been working as a meat vendor for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of meat, thus allowing her to meet increasing demands from her customers. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a meat stand and being able to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Sirly Johanna

texts.es:
La clienta Sirly vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó vendiendo productos por catalogo poco a poco mejoro sus ventas. Para emprender mas grande su negocio invirtió capital para un bazary papeleria. En la actualidad tiene una papeleria y sigue vendiendo por catalogo.

Ella trabaja sola desde las 08h00 hasta las 21h00 pm. Ella vende cuaderno, le da gracias a Dios por no tener dificultades en su negocio. Es soltera tiene una hija de 5 años que recién va a la escuela, 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar útiles escolares, uniformes ya que empezaron las clases. Su sueño es poder tener otro bazar por su familia para poder criar a su niña sin ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
Sirly lives in Guayaquil. She started by selling catalog products, and little by little improved her sales. In order to start a larger business, she invested capital in a stationery and gift store. Currently she has a stationary store and still sells by catalog. She works on her own from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. She sells notebooks and thanks God that she is not having difficulties in her business. 

She is single and has a five-year-old daughter who has recently started school. With the loan she wants to buy school supplies and uniforms, as classes have begun. Her dream is to have another store for her family, so that she can raise her daughter with no difficulty.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 23 years old. She lives in Kobuleti District with her parents and grandparents, who are provided with a retirement pension. Ketevan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Ketevan has a grocery shop. Her mother works as a cooker locally and gets a small monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Ketevan requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Ketevan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Ketevan will buy more stock of groceries. After purchasing the groceries, she will be able to offer her customers a wider range of products. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is single and has 2 children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Araba is now an established businesswoman. She sells rice in Afosua (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 3 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Araba uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Araba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice, thus helping to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 37-year-old beauty salon proprietor and chair hire business owner in Mishomuhoroni Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single mother of two school-going children and has been in this businesses for the last two years and done great.

This marks her third borrowing from KADET LTD to purchase beauty creams, soaps, shampoo, hair relaxers, and hair oil. She will use the anticipated profits to service her loan and educate her children.
